ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I often find myself at ''loose ends,'' not knowing what to do.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I find it hard to entertain myself.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Many things I have to do are repetitive and monotonous.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: It takes more stimulation to get me going than most people.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: I don't feel motivated by most things.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: In most situations, it is hard for me to find something to do or see to keep me interested.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Much of the time, I just sit around and do nothing.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Unless I am doing something exciting, even dangerous, I feel half-dead and dull.
Notes: 0 = Strongly Disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Neither Agree nor Disagree; 3 = Agree; 4 = Strongly Agree
Sum of items bp_short_1 - bp_short_8 on a 5-point scale( 0 points for items marked 0; 1 point for items marked 1; 4 points for items marked 4)
